text.0: of this our charming our celestial soma eloquent wise priest with inspired devotion.
text.1: of this thy close attendant hast thou drunken god send the singer food with milk to grace it.
text.2: craving the kine rushing against the mountain led on by law with holyminded comrades.
text.3: he broke the neverbroken ridge of vala with words of might indra subdued the paṇis.
text.4: this indu lighted darksome nights o indra throughout the years at morning and at evening.
text.5: him have they stablished as the days bright ensign he made the mornings to be born in splendour.
text.6: he shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not by law he lighted up the host of mornings.
text.7: he moves with steeds yoked by eternal order contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.
text.8: now praised o ancient king fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures.
text.9: give waters herbs that have no poison forests and kine and steeds and men to him who lauds thee.
